snippet: A panel of the Supreme Court threatened to dismiss Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gilani for not complying with orders to reopen corruption cases against President Asif Ali Zardari.
abstract: Panel of Pakistan's Supreme Court threatens to dismiss Prime Min Yousaf Raza Gilani for not complying with orders to reopen corruption cases against Pres Asif Ali Zardari; pressure from the court compounds problems faced by the governing Pakistan Peoples Party, which have already been exacerbated by increase in terrorist attacks.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and ISMAIL KHAN
byline.contributor: Salman Masood reported from Islamabad, and Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: A panel of the Supreme Court threatened to dismiss Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gilani for not complying with orders to reopen corruption cases against President Asif Ali Zardari.

headline.seo: In Pakistan, Truck Bomb Kills Dozens
headline.main: Pakistani Judges Press Premier to Defy President
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Judges Press Premier to Defy President
